data.title: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Quality Payment Program CTO
data.host: United States Digital Service at Department of Health and Human Services

achievements.description: Directed and supervised a team of over 200 developers building the Quality Payment Program website and API
Created and implemented the QPP Incident Response Plan to effectively respond to and resolve over thirty security and availability in a four-month period before launch of submission period
Launched initial submission period on time, with no system downtime or major user-facing issues
Oversaw release of a public API for QPP, providing a modern automated mechanism for submission of Medicare healthcare quality information for the first time at CMS
Wrote and awarded a $10 million contract for additional foundational infrastructure work to ensure a solid infrastructural base on which to continue iterating on and improving the system

data.title: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services - Director of Engineering
data.host: US Digital Service at Department of Homeland Security

achievements.description: Supervised a team of 150 developers working to design, develop, and deliver functionality for the Electronic Immigration System (ELIS), which handles backend processing for most major USCIS immigration benefits

Resolved critical issues with the Naturalization benefit in ELIS by designing and executing a Situation Room protocol enabling product managers and developers to interface directly with users experiencing bugs
Resolved over 100 issues and scaling interviews from 10/day to 2,000/day within two months
Designed and developed the VERIFI tool which allows ELIS developers to validate in minutes the correct operation of the background check subsystems on thousands of checks run each day
Managed team of nine engineers who perform all backend engineering and data science tasks for an infrastructure handling over 1.5M users a day
Lead ongoing recruiting efforts to acquire talented, independent, and highly motivated engineers
Designed and executed a new recruiting pipeline for data scientists, resulting in two hires onto a new team
Created summer internship program, attracting three paid interns in the first summer who completed substantial improvements to our matching, interest, and data infrastructures
Redesigned billing system to handle tracking multiple subscriptions per user
Unified tracking of billing transactions run through 5 different billing systems, including Paypal, Apple, and Google Play mobile billing
Designed Bloom filter based optimization to save 30% (1.2 TB) of RAM over all match servers
Designed and built event tracking log for all actions on OkCupid which handles >400M events/day
Promoted to Lead Software Engineer, duties expanded to include mentoring other engineers and a larger role in design and architecture of the site as a whole (Feb 2013)
Took on technical lead for development of new app, Crazy Blind Date
Developed an entirely new date scheduling and matching algorithm
Refactored core infrastructure of OkCupid to be shared by Crazy Blind Date
Built and maintained features on all OkCupid backend services

data.title: B.S. in Computer Science and Engineering

achievements.description: Achieved a GPA of 5.0 out of 5.0
